DataElement.preferredName: Image Series Frame of Reference Unique Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Unique identifier for the frame of reference for an imaging series. Each series shall have a single Frame of Reference UID, while multiple Series within a Study may share a Frame of Reference UID.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Image Series Frame of Reference Identity Unique Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Unique identifier for the frame of reference for an imaging series. Each series shall have a single Frame of Reference UID, while multiple Series within a Study may share a Frame of Reference UID.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.:A number of things or events standing or succeeding in order, and connected by a like relation. (from On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.
A group or succession of objects, substances, or events arranged in regular order in space or time, connected by a like relation, or forming a kind of chain.

Property.preferredName: Frame of Reference Identity Unique Identifier
Property.preferredDefinition: There is a defined equivalence between the Frame of Reference of the Registration SOP instance and the Frame of Reference of the referenced images.:The single one of its kind.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: There is a defined equivalence between the Frame of Reference of the Registration SOP instance and the Frame of Reference of the referenced images.
The single one of its kind.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6/18/09 created to reflect change to Image Series OC (2436196) per VCDE NCIA interim report.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Unique identifier for an object or person.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElement.changeDescription: 6/18/09 created to reflect change to Image Series OC (2436196) per VCDE NCIA interim report.
